QuestionStem: Explore how animals have evolved unique sensory abilities.

images.caption: This snake uses a structure called a pit organ to sense its prey, even in the dark. The organ contains electromagnetic sensors that can detect infrared radiation.
images.altText: This thermogram shows the infrared radiation given off by a mouse, which appears to glow brightly. The image shows a snake approaching the mouse.

images.caption: Octopuses and some of their relatives can change their skin color and texture to match their surroundings.
images.altText: In this photograph, an octopus blends into the ocean floor on which it sits.

images.caption: Jumping spiders have eight eyes. The four pairs of eyes work together to give these spiders incredibly sharp vision.
images.altText: This photograph shows a front view of a spider with multiple sets of eyes.
